Ahmed.meaning_extended: A name meaning 'greatly praised' and one of the names of the Prophet Muhammad.

Mohammed.meaning_extended: The most common name in the world, it translates to 'praiseworthy' or 'lauded'.

Youssef.meaning_extended: The Arabic form of Joseph, meaning 'God increases' or 'God will add'.

Said.meaning_extended: A cheerful name that literally translates to 'happy' or 'lucky'.

Amine.meaning_extended: Refers to someone who is 'trustworthy', 'honest', or 'faithful'.

Mehdi.meaning_extended: A spiritual name meaning 'the rightly guided one'.

Hicham.meaning_extended: An ancient name meaning 'generous' or 'one who smashes bread' (a sign of hospitality).

Mostapha.meaning_extended: One of the titles of the Prophet, meaning 'the chosen one'.

Yassine.meaning: title of the Prophet, Quranic chapter
Yassine.meaning_extended: The name of a chapter in the Quran, often used as a title for the Prophet.

Brahim.meaning: father of many, father of nations
Brahim.meaning_extended: A regional variation of Ibrahim, meaning 'father of many' or 'father of nations'.

Hamza.meaning_extended: Meaning 'lion' or 'strong and steadfast', it was the name of the Prophet's uncle.

Ayoub.meaning_extended: The Arabic version of Job, symbolizing 'patience' and 'returning to God'.

Anass.meaning_extended: A friendly name meaning 'affectionate', 'sociable', or 'pleasant company'.

Samir.meaning_extended: A poetic name referring to a 'companion in evening talk'.

Idriss.meaning_extended: Thought to mean 'to study' or 'interpreter', often associated with the prophet Enoch.

Bilal.meaning_extended: Meaning 'moisture' or 'refreshing', it was the name of the first Muezzin in Islam.

Jawad.meaning_extended: Refers to someone who is 'generous', 'magnanimous', or 'open-handed'.

Larbi.meaning_extended: Common in North Africa, it simply means 'the Arab' or 'Arabic'.

Oussama.meaning_extended: A classic Arabic name for a 'lion'.

Amjad.meaning_extended: A superlative name meaning 'more glorious' or 'most illustrious'.

Adam.meaning_extended: The first human, meaning 'man' or 'made from the earth'.

Alaeddine.meaning: nobility of religion, excellence of faith
Alaeddine.meaning_extended: Meaning 'excellence of the faith' or 'nobility of religion'.

El Houssine.meaning_extended: A diminutive of Hassan, meaning 'little handsome one' or 'beautiful'.

Anys.meaning_extended: A name for a 'close companion' or someone who is 'genial'.

Fouad.meaning_extended: A poetic term specifically referring to the 'heart' or 'spirit'.

Fadi.meaning_extended: A title meaning 'the savior' or 'the redeemer'.

Wail.meaning_extended: Meaning 'one who seeks shelter' or 'returning to peace'.

Ilyas.meaning_extended: The Arabic form of Elijah, meaning 'My God is Yahweh'.

Nouh.meaning_extended: The Arabic form of Noah, meaning 'rest' or 'comfort'.

Wassim.meaning_extended: Refers to someone who is 'graceful' or 'distinguished in appearance'.

Karim.meaning_extended: One of the 99 names of God, meaning 'generous' or 'noble'.

Redouan.meaning_extended: Meaning 'satisfaction', 'pleasure', or 'the keeper of the gates of heaven'.

Abdollah.meaning_extended: A humble name meaning 'servant of God'.

Youness.meaning_extended: The Arabic version of Jonah, meaning 'dove'.

Faysal.meaning_extended: Meaning 'a decisive leader' or 'one who separates truth from falsehood'.

Hamid.meaning_extended: A name meaning 'praiseworthy' or 'one who praises'.

Rayan.meaning_extended: Meaning 'luxuriant' or 'well-watered', it is the name of a gate in Paradise.

Tarik.meaning_extended: Often translated as 'the morning star' or 'one who knocks at the door'.

Mouad.meaning_extended: Meaning 'protected' or 'one who is under God's protection'.

Najib.meaning_extended: Refers to someone of 'noble birth' or an 'intelligent' person.

Hakim.meaning_extended: A name for a 'wise man' or a 'physician'.

Reda.meaning_extended: Meaning 'contentment', 'satisfaction', or 'being pleased with God’s will'.

Bassam.meaning_extended: A cheerful name meaning 'one who smiles often'.

Bouchaib.meaning_extended: A traditional Moroccan name likely referring to 'the one with many young ones'.

Abdelilah.meaning_extended: A religious name meaning 'servant of the Deity'.

Abdesalam.meaning_extended: A peaceful name meaning 'servant of Peace'.

Abdelmalek.meaning_extended: Meaning 'servant of the King' or 'servant of the Sovereign'.

Saif.meaning_extended: A sharp and strong name meaning 'sword'.

Rayad.meaning_extended: A variation of Riyadh, meaning 'gardens' or 'meadows'.

Nasser.meaning_extended: A strong name meaning 'victorious' or 'grantor of victory'.

Chafik.meaning_extended: Refers to someone who is 'compassionate', 'kind', or 'tender'.

Fariss.meaning_extended: A name for a 'knight', 'horseman', or 'perspicacious person'.

Azzedine.meaning_extended: Meaning 'the might of the faith' or 'power of religion'.

Imrane.meaning_extended: Refers to 'prosperity' and 'long-life', also the name of Mary’s father in the Quran.

Nourdine.meaning_extended: A radiant name meaning 'light of the religion'.

Rida.meaning_extended: A variation of Reda, meaning 'contentment' or 'approval'.

Nizar.meaning_extended: An old name meaning 'little' or 'scarce', historically tied to nobility.

Chouaib.meaning_extended: The name of a prophet, often associated with 'excellence' or 'showing the way'.

Elmahjoub.meaning_extended: Meaning 'the hidden one' or 'the veiled one'.

Marwan.meaning_extended: A name referring to 'flintstone' or 'a fragrant herb'.

Awss.meaning_extended: An ancient tribal name meaning 'gift' or 'wolf'.

Wissam.meaning_extended: A name meaning 'medal', 'badge of honor', or 'distinction'.
